value.title: Import your excel model into Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you spent hours creating an excel model with Power Query and PowerPivot and you or your company has now decided to move to Power BI?  Well, don't worry, you can import your excel models in Power BI and most of it will be imported, included the visuals if you created them using Power View, Yey!
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/s7i0VZ8OTRI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Intro to data modeling (Part2): Snowflake vs star vs galaxy schemes in Power BI
value.excerpt: We are going to continue developing the basic concepts of data modeling in Power BI, this time talking about different data models: snowflake vs star vs galaxy.  Part 1 of data modeling you will find it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V2mA40Z-R30  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Show rows with no data - Power BI Tips & Tricks #33
value.excerpt: By default, column headings are only displayed in your reports if they contain data. For example, if you were displaying revenue by country and had no sales in Norway, then Norway would not appear anywhere in your visualization.  In this video we will show you how to display empty categories or show

value.title: The wrong answers to 30 common Power BI interview questions 2022
value.excerpt: There are multiple websites that offer Power BI interview questions and answers and after reviewing them, I have collected 30 common Power BI interview questions that have wrong answers and together we will figure out what the right answer is.  Join me and lets clarify those topics once and for all!

value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to install power bi desktop so you get automatic downloads every time the power Bi team releases a new version. value.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
value.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common.
